description: This trap is generated when there is a change in the
stack configuration i.e. when either a new switch is
added to the stack or a switch leaves a stack.
ciscoTsNumSwitches indicates the current number of switches
which are part of the stack. The management station should
update its stack information according to the stack table.

event.Summary: Stack count has changed and now includes $v3 switches

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD CISCO-TS-STACK-MIB::ciscoTsStackCfgChange RFC1213-MIB::sysName s EXAMPLE RFC1213-MIB::sysLocation s EXAMPLE CISCO-TS-STACK-MIB::ciscoTsNumSwitches i 9999

description: This trap is generated when the stack switches over
from primary to secondary Matrix or from
secondary back to primary Matrix.

Summary.eval: ($v3 <= 2) ? 'Stack has switched over to $v3 Matrix' : 'Stack switching to/from Matrix produced $v3 status'

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD CISCO-TS-STACK-MIB::ciscoTsStackProStackMatrixChange RFC1213-MIB::sysName s EXAMPLE RFC1213-MIB::sysLocation s EXAMPLE CISCO-TS-STACK-MIB::ciscoTsProStackMatrixStatus i 1

description: This trap is generated when the temperature in a
switch exceeds normal or returns to normal.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD CISCO-TS-STACK-MIB::ciscoTsStackTempChange RFC1213-MIB::sysName s EXAMPLE RFC1213-MIB::sysLocation s EXAMPLE CISCO-TS-STACK-MIB::ciscoTsStackSwitchTemperature i 9999

description: This trap is generated when the status of the power supply
changes.

event.Summary: Switch $v1 power supply is currently in the $v3 state

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD CISCO-TS-STACK-MIB::ciscoTsStackPwrStatusChange RFC1213-MIB::sysName s EXAMPLE RFC1213-MIB::sysLocation s EXAMPLE CISCO-TS-STACK-MIB::ciscoTsStackSwitchPwrSupplyStatus i 1

description: This trap is generated when a port automatically
enters store and forward mode when the error rate
exceeds the threshold.

event.Summary: Port on $v1 is currently in the $v3 state

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD CISCO-TS-STACK-MIB::ciscoTsPortStrNFwdEntry RFC1213-MIB::sysName s EXAMPLE RFC1213-MIB::sysLocation s EXAMPLE CISCO-TS-STACK-MIB::ciscoTsPortCfgActualForwardingMode i 1

description: This trap occurs when a port is disabled because
it has exceeded its Configuration Loss Threshold
within the configured Sampling Period.

event.Summary: Port on $v1 disabled due to exceeding it's configuration loss threshold

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD CISCO-TS-STACK-MIB::ciscoTsPortCfgLossTrap RFC1213-MIB::sysName s EXAMPLE RFC1213-MIB::sysLocation s EXAMPLE CISCO-TS-STACK-MIB::ciscoTsPortStatsCfgLoss i 9999

description: This trap is generated when a port or a station local to a
port begins to beacon. It is sent out only when a ring status
change indicates that a station is beaconing.

event.Summary: Port $v3 on $v1 has begun to beacon

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD CISCO-TS-STACK-MIB::ciscoTsBeaconStart RFC1213-MIB::sysName s EXAMPLE RFC1213-MIB::sysLocation s EXAMPLE CISCO-TS-STACK-MIB::ciscoTsPortCfgNumber i 9

description: This trap is generated when the ring status change indicates
that a ring is no longer beaconing. This trap only occurs only
once when the status actually changes.

event.Summary: Port $v3 on $v1 is no longer beaconing

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD CISCO-TS-STACK-MIB::ciscoTsBeaconEnd RFC1213-MIB::sysName s EXAMPLE RFC1213-MIB::sysLocation s EXAMPLE CISCO-TS-STACK-MIB::ciscoTsPortCfgNumber i 9

description: This trap is generated when a duplicate MAC address is detected
on a port in a TrCRF which already has learned that MAC address.

event.Summary: Duplicate MAC address detected on Port $v3 on $v1

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD CISCO-TS-STACK-MIB::ciscoTsDuplicateMACAddr RFC1213-MIB::sysName s EXAMPLE RFC1213-MIB::sysLocation s EXAMPLE CISCO-TS-STACK-MIB::ciscoTsPortCfgNumber i 9

description: This trap is generated when a station local to a port
exceeds its Soft Error Threshold within the configured
interval.

event.Summary: Station $v6 on $v1 has exceeded it's Soft Error threshold

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD CISCO-TS-STACK-MIB::ciscoTsPortSoftErrExceededTrap RFC1213-MIB::sysName s EXAMPLE RFC1213-MIB::sysLocation s EXAMPLE CISCO-TS-STACK-MIB::ciscoTsStackSwitchNumber i 8 CISCO-TS-STACK-MIB::ciscoTsPortCfgNumber i 9 TOKEN-RING-RMON-MIB::ringStationIfIndex i 9999 TOKEN-RING-RMON-MIB::ringStationMacAddress s 999999 IF-MIB::ifName s EXAMPLE

description: This trap is a TrCRF specific version of the
newRoot trap as described in RFC1493.
The newRoot trap indicates that the sending agent
has become the new root of the Spanning Tree; the
trap is sent by a bridge soon after its election
as the new root, e.g., upon expiration of the
Topology Change Timer immediately subsequent to
its election. Implementation of this trap is
optional.

event.Summary: TrCRF ID $v3 - $v1 is now the new root of the Spanning Tree

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD CISCO-TS-STACK-MIB::ciscoTsTrCRFNewRoot RFC1213-MIB::sysName s EXAMPLE RFC1213-MIB::sysLocation s EXAMPLE CISCO-TS-STACK-MIB::ciscoTsTrCRFInfoTrCRFNumber i 999

description: This trap is a TrCRF specific version of the
topologyChange trap as described in RFC1493.
A topologyChange trap is sent by a bridge when
any of its configured ports transitions from the
Learning state to the Forwarding state, or from
the Forwarding state to the Blocking state. The
trap is not sent if a newRoot trap is sent for the
same transition. Implementation of this trap is
optional.

event.Summary: TrCRF ID $v3 - Topology of $v1 has changed due to port transition between Learning/Forwarding/Blocking

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD CISCO-TS-STACK-MIB::ciscoTsTrCRFTopologyChange RFC1213-MIB::sysName s EXAMPLE RFC1213-MIB::sysLocation s EXAMPLE CISCO-TS-STACK-MIB::ciscoTsTrCRFInfoTrCRFNumber i 999

description: This trap is a TrBRF specific version of the
newRoot trap as described in RFC1493.
The newRoot trap indicates that the sending agent
has become the new root of the Spanning Tree; the
trap is sent by a bridge soon after its election
as the new root, e.g., upon expiration of the
Topology Change Timer immediately subsequent to
its election. Implementation of this trap is
optional.

event.Summary: TrBRF ID $v3 - $v1 is now the new root of the Spanning Tree

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD CISCO-TS-STACK-MIB::ciscoTsTrBRFNewRoot RFC1213-MIB::sysName s EXAMPLE RFC1213-MIB::sysLocation s EXAMPLE CISCO-TS-STACK-MIB::ciscoTsTrBRFInfoTrBRFNumber i 999

description: This trap is a TrBRF specific version of the
topologyChange trap as described in RFC1493.
A topologyChange trap is sent by a bridge when
any of its configured ports transitions from the
Learning state to the Forwarding state, or from
the Forwarding state to the Blocking state. The
trap is not sent if a newRoot trap is sent for the
same transition. Implementation of this trap is
optional.

event.Summary: TrBRF ID $v3 - Topology of $v1 has changed due to port transition between Learning/Forwarding/Blocking

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD CISCO-TS-STACK-MIB::ciscoTsTrBRFTopologyChange RFC1213-MIB::sysName s EXAMPLE RFC1213-MIB::sysLocation s EXAMPLE CISCO-TS-STACK-MIB::ciscoTsTrBRFInfoTrBRFNumber i 999

description: This trap is sent when one of the links in an
TokenChannel fail. The variable ciscoTsTCPorts
contains the ports which are operational in the
TokenChannel.

event.Summary: Links in a TokenChannel have failed effecting $v3 ports on $v1

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD CISCO-TS-STACK-MIB::ciscoTsTokenChannelFailed RFC1213-MIB::sysName s EXAMPLE RFC1213-MIB::sysLocation s EXAMPLE CISCO-TS-STACK-MIB::ciscoTsTCPorts s 9999

description: This trap is sent to report a TokenChannel or
ISLChannel status change. The variable ciscoTsTCStatus
contains the current channel status. The variable
ciscoTsTCPorts contains the ports which are configured
in the channel. The variable ciscoTsTCActivePorts
contains the ports which are active in the channel.

event.Summary: TokenChannel or ISLChannel status change to $v3 with $v4 configured and $v5 active ports on $v1

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD CISCO-TS-STACK-MIB::ciscoTsTokenChannelStatus RFC1213-MIB::sysName s EXAMPLE RFC1213-MIB::sysLocation s EXAMPLE CISCO-TS-STACK-MIB::ciscoTsTCStatus i 1 CISCO-TS-STACK-MIB::ciscoTsTCPorts s 9999 CISCO-TS-STACK-MIB::ciscoTsTCActivePorts s 9999
